intro: Barleria antunesii, commonly known as the Natal barleria, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Barleria antunesii is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
